text: Hi everyone, anyone can help me to create a authentication to use the api?
See <#CD5RBLPBL|cms-membership> it’s an enterprise feature but enables user logins on the front end of CMS sites
Hi <@U7SL518D6>, but I referred to authentication of the api
oh sorry I misinterpreted for some reason.

<@UHGJ1MN14> There are two methods of authentication for the HubSpot API.  API keys, which are good for one off use cases like scripts or integrations that will only be used in-house.  Then we have OAuth 2.0 which allow you to write an integration that can be installed in multiple HubSpot Accounts, it’s also more secure as access_tokens are scoped to just what they need whereas API keys always have full access to the account
Here’s an overview doc that goes into more detail <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/auth/oauth-overview>
Hi <@UFBNA9K9A>, this is the error when I try to get the token
so if I could ask what may be a silly question. Are you including the client secret in the body of the request?
Thanks <@UFBNA9K9A>, I can solve it, the client_secret was wrong writing
Hi <@UFBNA9K9A>, I try to use the API to create and update contacts, but the answer is unsatisfactory.
what’ the JSON you are trying to send?
this is my request
So the contacts endpoint is looking JSON, not form encoded data
in postman, you can go over to the “raw” option over the body then a new dropdown will appear where you can select Application/JSON
Thank you <@UFBNA9K9A>, it's worked
thanks for the help <@UFBNA9K9A>

Hi everyone - I'm trying to pull basic landing page stats - but for a subset of pages where the name of the page matches a certain set of criteria...right now I'm pulling all the landing pages, filtering by name, and then getting stats by landing page ID for all of the resulting pages...it's too slow...so I'm trying to figure out a way to bulk pull stats for all landing pages....
What do the breakdowns that result from the /analytics/v2/reports/landing-pages/total/ endpoint correspond to?  I was hopoing it was the ID of the landing page...but doesnt seem to be...
Update : it turns out the breakdowns are in fact the ID of the landing page...but the IDs come back as int in one API and STR in the other so I had to cast them to compare them...all good now.
Hey <@UGULQ6P6D> thanks for the update. I’ve flagged this internally. Not sure we can get it fixed immediately but at least it’s will be in our backlog now
Thanks <@UFBNA9K9A>! not urgent for sure, but good to keep on a list.
